intro: Lobelia hortensis, commonly known as the garden lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and prefers moist, well-drained soil. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Lobelia hortensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in partial to full shade.
